sentences.sContent: For young children, getting dressed is a complicated business.
sentences.sCn: 对幼童来说，穿衣服是件复杂的事。

sentences.sContent: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.sCn: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

sentences.sContent: ...Ukrainians have been drawing complicated patterns on eggs...
...Russell argues that as robots take on more complicated tasks...
...many that are more complicated than the ones they do try to teach him...
...her most urgent and perhaps most complicated duty may be simple to be herself...
...The plot is so complicated that I really got lost...

remMethod.val: com(共同) ＋ plic(重叠) ＋ ated → 重叠在一起的 → 复杂的

words.tran: 并发症；复杂；复杂化；混乱
使复杂化；使恶化；使卷入

trans.tranOther: difficult to understand or deal with, because many parts or details are involved
